newsitem.title: ZAIRE: U.S. envoy in talks with Zaire rebel chief.
newsitem.headline: U.S. envoy in talks with Zaire rebel chief.

text.p: U.S. envoy Bill Richardson met rebel leader Laurent Kabila in Lubumbashi on Monday shortly after the rebel leader said his forces were closing in on Kinshasa.
Richardson, U.S. ambassador to the United Nations and President Bill Clinton's envoy, went straight into talks with Kabila shortly after arriving in Zaire's second city.
"This is an urgent mission to see whether bloodshed can be avoided in Kinshasa. Richardson is bringing an urgent message from President Clinton," a U.S. diplomat told Reuters.
Richardson said he would address a news conference after his closed-door talks with Kabila.
Kabila earlier on Monday said his rebel forces would chase President Mobutu Sese Seko out of the Zairean capital Kinshasa unless Mobutu handed over power by the time they arrived.
